SEARCH
Package com.landawn.abacus.util

Class Profiler

java.lang.Object
com.landawn.abacus.util.Profiler
public final class Profiler extends Object
A simple way to run load/performance tests.

Caution: if the loop number is too big, it may take a lot of memory to save the test result and impact the test result.
So instead of running the performance with big loop number: 
 
 final int bigLoopNum = 1000_000;
 Profiler.run(threadNum, bigLoopNum, roundNum, "yourMethod", () -> yourMethod());
 

 // reduce the bigLoopNum by for-loop:

 
 Profiler.run(threadNum, bigLoopNum / 1000, roundNum, "yourMethod", () ->
  {
      for (int i = 0; i < 1000; i++) {
          yourMethod();
      }
  });
See Also:
  • Introduction to Java Microbenchmarking with JMH

  • Method Details

    • run

      public static Profiler.MultiLoopsStatistics run(int threadNum, int loopNum, int roundNum, Throwables.Runnable<? extends Exception> command)
      Runs a performance test with the specified number of threads, loops, and rounds.
      Parameters:
      threadNum - the number of threads to use
      loopNum - the number of loops to run in each thread
      roundNum - the number of rounds to repeat the test
      command - the command to be executed in each loop
      Returns:
      the statistics of the performance test

    • run

      public static Profiler.MultiLoopsStatistics run(int threadNum, int loopNum, int roundNum, String label, Throwables.Runnable<? extends Exception> command)
      Runs a performance test with the specified number of threads, loops, and rounds, and a custom label.
      Parameters:
      threadNum - the number of threads to use
      loopNum - the number of loops to run in each thread
      roundNum - the number of rounds to repeat the test
      label - a custom label for the test
      command - the command to be executed in each loop
      Returns:
      the statistics of the performance test

    • run

      public static Profiler.MultiLoopsStatistics run(int threadNum, long threadDelay, int loopNum, long loopDelay, int roundNum, String label, Throwables.Runnable<? extends Exception> command)
      Runs a performance test with the specified number of threads, thread delay, loops, loop delay, rounds, and a custom label.
      Parameters:
      threadNum - the number of threads to use
      threadDelay - the delay between starting each thread
      loopNum - the number of loops to run in each thread
      loopDelay - the delay between each loop
      roundNum - the number of rounds to repeat the test
      label - a custom label for the test
      command - the command to be executed in each loop
      Returns:
      the statistics of the performance test

    • suspend

      public static void suspend(boolean yesOrNo)
      Suspends or resumes performance tests running on Profiler. If the performance tests are suspended, the Profiler will only execute one loop with one thread for each test.
      Parameters:
      yesOrNo - if true, the profiler is suspended; if false, the profiler is resumed
